Grain.Do: Whole grains like quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), amaranth (1/2 cup cooked), millet (1/2 cup cooked). Focus on cooked grains to aid digestion and add nourishment. Brown rice (1/2 cup cooked) can be included moderately.
Grain.Dont: Refined grains like white rice, white bread, pastries. Excessive amounts of dry, raw grains.

Legume.Do: Cooked lentils (1/2 cup), mung beans (1/2 cup), split peas (1/2 cup). Soaking and thorough cooking are essential to reduce gas and improve digestibility for Kapha. Small amounts of chickpeas (1/4 cup cooked) with warming spices.
Legume.Dont: Large quantities of dry beans, raw legumes, or legumes that tend to cause gas like kidney beans.

Veg.Do: Cooked, warm, and easily digestible vegetables like asparagus (1 cup), carrots (1 cup), sweet potatoes (1/2 cup), zucchini (1 cup), beets (1/2 cup). Steaming or light sautéing is best. Jerusalem artichokes (1/2 cup) are beneficial for diabetes.
Veg.Dont: Raw vegetables, cold vegetables, heavy vegetables like potatoes (in large amounts), eggplant, tomatoes (can be acidic). Bitter greens in excess.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices: ginger (1/2 inch fresh or 1/4 tsp dried), cinnamon (1/4 tsp), cardamom (1/4 tsp), cumin (1/4 tsp), turmeric (1/4 tsp), black pepper (pinch). Fenugreek seeds (1/2 tsp soaked overnight and consumed) for diabetes.
Spices.Dont: Excessive use of very pungent spices like red chili powder. Cold spices like coriander (in large amounts).

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1 cup cooked), kale (1 cup cooked), mustard greens (1 cup cooked). Lightly sautéed with warming spices.
Leafy veg.Dont: Large quantities of raw leafy greens. Bitter leafy greens in excess.

Oil.Do: Small amounts of warming oils like ghee (1 tsp for cooking, if tolerated, otherwise skip), sesame oil (1 tsp for cooking or massage), or olive oil (1 tsp for cooking).
Oil.Dont: Heavy, cold oils. Excessive amounts of any oil.

Fruits.Do: Warm, ripe, and naturally sweet fruits in moderation: berries (1/2 cup), cooked apples (1/2 apple), pears (1/2 pear), figs (2-3 dried or 1 fresh). Best consumed between meals or earlier in the day.
Fruits.Dont: Sour, unripe, or very cold fruits. Large quantities of fruits, especially those high in natural sugars. Citrus fruits in large amounts.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Small portions of soaked and peeled almonds (4-6), walnuts (2-3 halves). Raisins (1 tbsp soaked) can be included for energy and to balance sweetness.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Large quantities of raw nuts. Heavy, oily nuts like cashews or macadamia nuts. Dry, unsalted nuts.

Milk product.Do: As vegan, focus on plant-based alternatives. Small amounts of warm plant-based milk (e.g., almond, oat) with digestive spices (1 cup).
Milk product.Dont: Dairy products are avoided as per vegan diet.

Condiments.Do: Freshly grated ginger, small amounts of lemon juice (diluted in warm water).
Condiments.Dont: Excessively sour, spicy, or cold condiments.
